results.title: Marc Chagall/the colours of passion
results.creator_credit: Charles Harris and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Focuses on the diverse artistic achievements of Marc Chagall. Explains his often perplexing subject matter and passion for colour in terms of his stated desire to create a world where anything is possible. Includes examples of his work, along with a discussion of his background and the influences of impressionism, cubism and Russia on his inspiration. Cameraman by Derek Waterman; quotations by Cyril Shaps and commentary by Paul Gregory. Suitable for Years 7-12.

results.title: Marbles
results.brief_description: Edward fears he is losing his grip on reality. Outwardly, he appears grumpier. Eventually he tells his wife she is the only thing that he can remember - but can she help him and what can be done? A poignant film about ageing, shot in black and white featuring Willie Fennell, Moya O’Sullivan and Noni Hazlehurst.

results.title: Marathon the ultimate challenge
results.creator_credit: Alan Jacques, Patrick Ramsey and Marathon Film Productions
results.brief_description: An award winning film about the determination, the satisfaction and the exhilaration of running a marathon. This film takes the viewer into a marathon and gives insight into what a runner experiences. This is more than a sports film - it is a film about setting a goal, working towards it and achieving it.

results.title: Marathon man (D)
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Sidney Beckerman, Robert Evans and Connaught Productions
results.brief_description: Adapted by legendary screenwriter William Goldman from his own novel and directed by one of the seventies’ most intriguing filmmakers, John Schlesinger (Midnight Cowboy), ‘Marathon Man’ is one of that decade’s most handsome thrillers. Dustin Hoffman is Babe Levy, an impoverished history student living in the shadow of his father’s suicide. Daily, Babe tests himself running the streets of New York, but the ultimate test comes when his dubious brother (Roy Scheider) springboards the marathon man into an international conspiracy of diamonds, Nazis and double-crossings. Despite a stand-out performance by Laurence Olivier and some of the most well-known torture sequences in cinema history, ‘Marathon Man’ is perhaps little more than a run-of-the-mill thriller. Accepted as such, it is nonetheless a satisfying one.

results.title: Marathon I
results.creator_credit: Tim Kupsch and John Blackett-Smith Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the individual training strategies and motivation of top world marathon runner Robert de Castella of Australia and Alberto Salazar of the USA. Follows each of them as they fight it out in the 1982 Rotterdam marathon, highlighting the incredible winning performance by de Castella, who after having run twenty-five miles at a rate of five minutes per mile, covered the last mile in a staggering four minutes and thirty-two seconds.

results.title: Marastoon: the place where one is helped
results.creator_credit: Guy L. Cote, Peter Hollander, J.-P. Olivier Fougeres and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Marastoon is situated on the outskirts of Kabul, Afghanistan. It is a government-funded institution created to shelter and train homeless people of all ages. Money saved on food donated by the United Nations World Food Program is used to buy equipment for vocational training and supplies for a handicraft co-operative. A film without words.

results.title: Maps: how to read them
results.creator_credit: Sal Bruno, Phoenix Films and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: This film uses excellent graphics and animation to explain the concepts of map projection and latitude and longitude, to show how symbols are used on maps, and the importance of scale, legend, key, the compass role and grid references in map reading.

results.title: Maps: art and science
results.brief_description: Contrasts early maps with those of today, and then shows the technical procedures required in map making. The results of surveying, aerial photography, and barometric readings are gradually built up until they form a precise representation of the earths surface. Shows the various stages of the process in Sweden.

results.title: Maps: an introduction
results.brief_description: Describes how maps are made by showing a class constructing a map from a model of a town. Depicts the use of a legend and shows how a scale is derived. Illustrates how to locate a community on a world globe and on other maps. No other credits available.
